intro: Taeniophyllum philippinense, commonly known as the Philippine star moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a thalloid structure, with a flat, leaf-like body that is covered in tiny, scale-like structures. It plays an important role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats. Taeniophyllum philippinense is native to the Philippines and is often found growing on rocks or tree trunks in humid forests.
